alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains; Far Northwest Highlands; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Northwest Highlands; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; South Central Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southwest Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama; Upper Rio Grande Valley; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 21 at 8:32AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...SNOWFALL TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT TO CREATE SLICK TRAVEL OVER THE WESTERN AND CENTRAL MOUNTAINS ABOVE 7500 FEET... Rounds of snowfall are expected over portions of western and central New Mexico, including the Chuska, Tusas, Jemez, Sangre de Cristo, Sandia and Manzano and Sacramento mountains as well as the peaks of the Gila, today through Tuesday night. Snowfall accumulations will likely be limited below about 7500 feet, while the greater accumulations are expected over the peaks. Expect to encounter slick travel conditions on area roadways above 7500 feet if traveling over mountain passes and over the Continental Divide. Motorists should exercise caution, be prepared for rapidly changing visibilities and slick roadways. Allow extra time to reach your destination. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit nmroads.com.
